p: Indoor air pollution is a major global public health threat requiring increased hard work, linking research to policy-making. The evidence of the effects of physical and chemical pollutants on human health, present in the external and internal environment has no superior aggression than the existing bioaerosols. Health effects from indoor air pollutants may be experienced soon after exposure or, possibly, years later, according to the nature of air contaminants, being classified, in an abbreviated approach, as physical, chemical or biological (Nazaroff, 2016).
